title.rendered: 8 Best LA Neighborhoods For Young Professionals

content.rendered:
Los Angeles is one of the world’s most populous cities and it is well known as a cultural and entertainment hub. This vast city opens up a wide range of opportunities for many individuals, and if you’re a young professional, then it is one of the best places you can live. If you’re moving to the area and are looking for the best neighborhoods in LA for young professionals, then you’ve come to the right place. Read on to learn more!

1. Beverlywood

  • Walk Score: 87
  • Bike Score: 76
  • Transit Score: 60

If you’re looking for a slightly less expensive Beverly Hills experience, then Beverlywood is the place for you. When you’re living in Los Angeles as a young professional, you should know that Beverlywood is conveniently located near 405, 101, and Sepulveda Boulevard, allowing you to avoid LA’s notorious traffic. There are plenty of good schools in this area, and it gives residents an urban-suburban feel. Due to its proximity to larger cities, Beverlywood is definitely a top pick for young professionals who are moving to Los Angeles.

2. Culver City

  • Walk Score: 63
  • Bike Score: 42
  • Transit Score: 48

If you’re seeking out the best neighborhoods in LA for young professionals, then Culver City should definitely be on your list of options. This hotspot in Los Angeles is great for both families and working adults, with lots of fun things to explore including museums and art galleries. This neighborhood is also desirable because it is surrounded by colleges that can help young people pursue their academic goals.

Find Rooms For Rent In Culver Hills, LA

3. Downtown Los Angeles

  • Walk Score: 93
  • Bike Score: 78
  • Transit Score: 98

High-class public transportation? Check. Close to important business areas? Check. This neighborhood in LA ticks some of the most important boxes on the list for young professionals in LA. This city provides extensive transportation options, making it very convenient for daily errands. Downtown Los Angeles is a perfect blend of the urban and community feel, and it is a prime location for skilled workers. If you’re planning on moving to Los Angeles, then this is a great choice.

Find Rooms For Rent In Downtown Los Angeles

4. Los Feliz

  • Walk Score: 72
  • Bike Score: 29
  • Transit Score: 44

With plenty of restaurants, safe streets, access to subway routes, and large houses, Los Feliz is great for young professionals looking to combine work and fun. This Los Angeles neighborhood next to Griffith Park is perfect for budding career starters looking to settle down in a more upscale area of the city. Los Feliz is also very close to the LA Expo line, making it one of the best neighborhoods in LA for young professionals who commute. Another upside to this location is that around 42% of residents 25 and older have a four-year degree, which helps to drive success in young people.

5. Santa Monica

  • Walk Score: 82
  • Bike Score: 86
  • Transit Score: 62

A lot of young professionals reside in this beautiful beach community which is home to oceanside bungalows, upscale bars, and various shopping options. Outdoor living and tantalizing cuisines are also big here, so newbies to the area are in for a treat. Santa Monica is a highly educated area where many residents work long hours but can return to enjoy the affordable amenities that it offers. If you’re a young professional moving to Los Angeles, then Santa Monica is surely one of the best neighborhoods you will find.

Find Rooms For Rent In Santa Monica

6. Echo Park

  • Walk Score: 93
  • Bike Score: 37
  • Transit Score: 59

Echo Park is a vibrant and funky neighborhood that borders Downtown Los Angeles, Chinatown, and Silver Lake. As well as its great location, this budding area has all that a young professional could desire. You’ll find spacious parks, quick access to US-101 and US-110 highways, and lots of trendy eateries, bars, and coffee shops along Sunset Blvd. Echo Park is also only a 15-minute drive from downtown LA, so it’s easy to get to work in the city.

Find Rooms For Rent In Echo Park

7. South Pasadena

  • Walk Score: 74
  • Bike Score: 56
  • Transit Score: 51

Most students and young professionals tend to flock to Pasadena, which houses plenty of amenities. In this LA neighborhood, you’ll find parks, coffee shops, and great colleges that local twenty-somethings can enjoy. Just ten miles from Downtown, it provides a range of affordable housing options to suit your needs. Choose from classic townhouses and simple condos to sprawling Mediterranean-style homes. Either way, if you’re moving to Los Angeles, rest assured that Pasadena is one of the best areas to live in LA.

Find Rooms For Rent In Pasadena
